metadata.description: If Yes, will run a delay step to assist with the Dataverse health. Only turn to No for debugging.
REQUIRED. Environment, including geographic location, for Power Automate - Ex for commercial: https://flow.microsoft.com/manage/environments/
Have you set up data export in PPAC and is your inventory and telemetry in an Azure Data Storage folder (also referred to as Bring your own Datalake, self-serve analytics feature)

Check_if_Legacy_Environment.description: Legacy and Default environments have the same GUID, prefixed by Legacy- or Default- which is causing issues as the Record Identifier is using the GUID as a unique identifier. We are therefore using a generated GUID for the entity.

Name_Length.description: Returns the index where the GUID starts

Remove_any_Environment_prefix.description: Returns the GUID without any prefix (right 36 chars)

parameters.item/admin_flowinstanceurl: @concat(parameters('Power Automate Environment Variable (admin_PowerAutomateEnvironmentVariable)'), workflow()?['tags']['environmentName'], '/flows/', workflow()?['name'], '/runs/', workflow()?['run']['name'])

Initialize_variable_flowEnvironment.description: Environment location specific Flow URL - remember / at the end

Initialize_variable_isCDS.description: Environment location specific Flow URL - remember / at the end

Delay_1_to_900_minutes.description: For Dataverse servie health, we will randomize the start time of these flows for tenants within a 15 hour range

equals: @parameters('Inventory and Telemetry in Azure Data Storage account (admin_InventoryandTelemetryinAzureDataStorageaccount)')

Catch_-_not_ready_to_take_last_run_date.inputs: Catch - not ready to take last run date
